sen.j: 大伴 家持（おおとも の やかもち、養老2年（718年）頃 - 延暦4年8月28日 (旧暦)（785年10月5日））は奈良時代の政治家、歌人。
sen.e: OTOMO no Yakamochi (around 718 - October 5, 785) was the politician and kajin (waka poet) in Nara period.
OTOMO no Yakamochi (c.718 - October 5, 785) was a politician and kajin (waka poet) who lived during the Nara period.
OTOMO no Yakamochi (c.718 - October 5, 785) was a politician and kajin (waka poet) who lived during the Nara period.

sen.j: 三十六歌仙の一人。
sen.e: He was one of the Thirty-six Immortal Poets.
He was one of the Thirty-six Poetry Immortals.
sen.cmt: Thirty-six Immortal Poets > Thirty-six Poetry Immortals
sen.e: He was one of the 36 Immortal Poets.

sen.j: 大納言大伴安麻呂の孫。
sen.e: He was the grandchild of OTOMO no Yasumaro, Dainagon (chief councilor of state).
He was the grandchild of Dainagon (chief councilor of state) OTOMO no Yasumaro.
He was the grandchild of Dainagon (chief councilor of state) OTOMO no Yasumaro.

sen.j: 大納言大伴旅人の子。
sen.e: He was the child of OTOMO no Tabito, Dainagon (chief councilor of state).
He was the child of Dainagon (chief councilor of state) OTOMO no Tabito.
He was the child of Dainagon (chief councilor of state) OTOMO no Tabito.

sen.j: 従三位・中納言。
sen.e: He was Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) and Chunagon (vice-councilor of state).
He was Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) and Chunagon (vice-councilor of state).
He was Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) and Chunagon (vice-councilor of state).

sen.j: 『万葉集』の編纂に関わる歌人として取り上げられることが多いが、大伴氏は大和朝廷以来の武門の家であり、祖父安麻呂、父旅人と同じく政治家として歴史に名を残す。
sen.e: He was referred to the kajin related to compilation of "Manyoshu" (Collection of Ten Thousand Leaves) most of the time, but the Otomo clan was the military family since Yamato Dynasty and earned his place in history as the politician as well as his grandfather Yasumaro and his father Tabito.

OTOMO no Yakamochi is often identified as the kajin involved in the compilation of "Manyoshu" (Collection of Ten Thousand Leaves), but the Otomo clan ha been a military family since the Yamato Dynasty and he earned his place in history as a politician just as his grandfather Yasumaro and father Tabido had done before him.

OTOMO no Yakamochi is often identified as the kajin involved in the compilation of "Manyoshu" (Collection of Ten Thousand Leaves), but the Otomo clan had been a military family since the Yamato Dynasty and he earned his place in history as a politician just as his grandfather Yasumaro and father Tabito had done before him.

sen.j: 天平の政争を生き延び、延暦年間に中納言まで昇る。
sen.e: He lived until the political strife in Tenpyo era and was promoted until Chunagon in Enryaku era.
He lived until the political strife in Tenpyo era and reached the level of Chunagon in the Enryaku era.
He lived until the political strife in Tenpyo era and reached the level of Chunagon in the Enryaku era.

sen.j: 天平10年（738年）に内舎人と見え、天平12年（740年）九州の大宰府にて藤原広嗣が起こした乱の平定を祈願する聖武天皇の伊勢国行幸に従駕。
sen.e: He became udoneri (Ministerial equerry) in 738 and attended the imperial visit of Emperor Shomu to Ise Province to pray for suppression of the incident that FUJIWARA no Hirotsugu caused in Dazai-fu, Kyushu region in 740.

He became udoneri (Ministerial equerry) in 738 and attended the imperial visit of Emperor Shomu to Ise Province to pray for the suppression of the incident that FUJIWARA no Hirotsugu caused in Dazai-fu, Kyushu region in 740.

He became udoneri (Ministerial equerry) in 738 and attended the imperial visit of Emperor Shomu to Ise Province to pray for the suppression of the incident that FUJIWARA no Hirotsugu caused in Dazai-fu, Kyushu region in 740.

sen.j: 天平17年（745年）に従五位に叙せられる。
sen.e: He was appointed to Jugoi (Junior Fifth Rank) in 745.
He was appointed to Jugoi (Junior Fifth Rank) in 745.
He was appointed to Jugoi (Junior Fifth Rank) in 745.

sen.j: 天平18年（746年）3月に宮内少輔、7月に越中国国守となる。
sen.e: He became Kunai shoyu/Kunai no sho (Junior Assistant Minister of the Sovereign's Household) in March, 746 and Ecchu no kuni no kami (Governor of Ecchu Province) in July.
He became Kunai shoyu/Kunai no sho (Junior Assistant Minister of the Sovereign's Household) in March 746 and Ecchu no kuni no kami (Governor of Ecchu Province) in July.
He became Kunai shoyu/Kunai no sho (Junior Assistant Minister of the Sovereign's Household) in March 746 and Ecchu no kuni no kami (Governor of Ecchu Province) in July.

sen.j: 天平勝宝3年（751年）までに赴任。
sen.e: He went to a new post until 751.
He was transferred to a new post in 751.
He was transferred to a new post in 751.

sen.j: この間に220余首の歌を詠んだ。
sen.e: He wrote over 220 poems during this time.
He wrote over 220 poems during this time.
He wrote over 220 poems during this time.

sen.j: 少納言となって帰京後、天平勝宝6年（754年）兵部少輔となり、翌年難波で防人の検校に関わる。
sen.e: After becoming Shonagon (lesser councilor of state) and returning to Kyoto, he became Hyobushoyu (deputy minister of military arm) in 754 and was involved in kengyo (temple or shrine administrator) of sakimori (soldiers deployed for boarder defenses) in Nanba next year.

After becoming Shonagon (lesser councilor of state) and returning to Kyoto, he became Hyobushoyu (deputy minister of military arm) in 75,4 and in the following year was involved in the inspection of sakimori (soldiers deployed for boarder defenses) in Nanba.

After becoming Shonagon (lesser councilor of state) and returning to Kyoto, he became Hyobushoyu (deputy minister of military arm) in 754, and in the following year was involved in the inspection of sakimori (soldiers deployed for boarder defenses) in Nanba.

sen.j: この時の防人との出会いが、万葉集の防人歌収集につながっている。
sen.e: Meeting with sakimori at this time led him to collect Sakimori-no-uta (Sakimori Guard's poetries) in Manyoshu.
Meeting with sakimori at this time led him to collect Sakimori-no-uta (poetry written by Sakimori soldiers) in Manyoshu.
Meeting with sakimori at this time led him to collect Sakimori-no-uta (poetry written by Sakimori soldiers) in Manyoshu.

sen.j: 天平宝字2年（758年）に因幡国国守。
sen.e: He became Inaba no kuni no kami (Governor of Inaba Province) in 758.
He became Inaba no kuni no kami (Governor of Inaba Province) in 758.
He became Inaba no kuni no kami (Governor of Inaba Province) in 758.

sen.j: 翌天平宝字3年（759年）1月に国府町 (鳥取県)で万葉集の最後の歌を詠む。
sen.e: He wrote the last poem in Manyoshu in Kokufu-cho (Tottori Prefecture) in February, 759.
He wrote the last poem in Manyoshu in Kokufu-cho (Tottori Prefecture) in February, 759.
He wrote the last poem in Manyoshu in Kokufu-cho (Tottori Prefecture) in February, 759.

sen.j: 橘奈良麻呂の変には参加しなかったものの、藤原良継（宿奈麻呂）、石上宅嗣、佐伯今毛人の3人と藤原仲麻呂暗殺計画を立案した。
sen.e: He did not attend TACHIBANA no Naramaro Disturbance but made plan to assassinate FUJIWARA no Nakamaro with FUJIWARA no Yoshitsugu (Sukunamaro), ISONOKAMI no Yakatsugu, and SAEKI no Imaemishi.

He did not participate in the TACHIBANA no Naramaro Disturbance but made plans to assassinate FUJIWARA no Nakamaro with FUJIWARA no Yoshitsugu (Sukunamaro), ISONOKAMI no Yakatsugu, and SAEKI no Imaemishi.

He did not participate in the TACHIBANA no Naramaro Disturbance but made plans to assassinate FUJIWARA no Nakamaro with FUJIWARA no Yoshitsugu (Sukunamaro), ISONOKAMI no Yakatsugu, and SAEKI no Imaemishi.

sen.j: 事件は未遂に終わり、藤原良継一人が責任を負ったため罪には問われなかった。
sen.e: The incident failed, and only FUJIWARA no Yoshitsugu accepted its responsibility, so he was not accused of the crime.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The incident failed, and FUJIWARA no Yoshitsugu accepted sole responsibility, so Yakamochi was not accused of the crime.
The incident failed, and FUJIWARA no Yoshitsugu accepted sole responsibility, so Yakamochi was not accused of the crime.

sen.j: しかし、天平宝字8年（764年）、薩摩国守への転任と言う報復人事を受けることになった。
sen.e: However, he received retribution personnel to be transferred to Satsuma no kuni no kami (Governor of Satsuma Province) in 764.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, he was punished by being appointed Satsuma no kuni no kami (Governor of Satsuma Province) in 764.
However, he was punished by being appointed Satsuma no kuni no kami (Governor of Satsuma Province) in 764.

sen.j: 神護景雲1年（767年）、大宰大弐に転じ、宝亀1年（770年）に民部少輔となるまでの間に宇佐八幡宮神託事件が起きているが、どのように関わったのかは不明。
sen.e: In 767, he changed his post to Dazai no daini (Senior Assistant Governor-General of the Dazai-fu offices), and a plot of Usa Hachiman-gu oracle happened before he became Minbu shoyu (Junior Assistant Minister of Popular Affairs) in 770, but it was unknown how he was involved in the plot.

In 767, he became Dazai no daini (Senior Assistant Governor-General of the Dazai-fu offices), and the Usa Hachiman-gu Shrine oracle plot occurred before he became Minbu shoyu (Junior Assistant Minister of Popular Affairs) in 770, but it was unknown how he was involved in the plot.

In 767, he became Dazai no daini (Senior Assistant Governor-General of the Dazai-fu offices), and the Usa Hachiman-gu Shrine oracle plot occurred before he became Minbu shoyu (Junior Assistant Minister of Popular Affairs) in 770, but it was unknown how he was involved in the plot.

sen.j: 宝亀7年（776年）、伊勢国国守。
sen.e: He became Ise no kuni no kami (Governor of Ise Province) in 776.
He became Ise no kuni no kami (Governor of Ise Province) in 776.
He became Ise no kuni no kami (Governor of Ise Province) in 776.

sen.j: 伊勢神宮の記録では5年ほど勤めたという。
sen.e: He served for 5 years according to the record of Ise-jingu Shrine.
He served for 5 years according to the records of Ise-jingu Shrine.
He served for 5 years according to the records of Ise-jingu Shrine.

sen.j: 宝亀11年（780年）、参議に昇進したものの、氷上川継の謀反事件（氷上川継の乱）に関与を疑われて都を追放されるなど、政治家として骨太な面を見ることができる。
sen.e: He was promoted to Sangi (councilor) in 780, but we could see his muscular side as the politician since he was expelled from the capital as he was suspected of invovlement in the intrigue of HIKAMI no Kawatsugu (HIKAMI no Kawatsugu's War).

Yakamochi's strength as a politician is demonstrated by the fact that although he was promoted to Sangi (councilor) in 780, he was expelled from the capital after being suspected of involvement in HIKAMI no Kawatsugu's plot (HIKAMI no Kawatsugu's Rebellion).

Yakamochi's strength as a politician is demonstrated by the fact that although he was promoted to Sangi (councilor) in 780, he was expelled from the capital after being suspected of involvement in HIKAMI no Kawatsugu's plot (HIKAMI no Kawatsugu's Rebellion).

sen.j: 延暦2年（783年）、中納言に昇進するが兼任していた陸奥按察使持節征東将軍の職務のために陸奥国に滞在中に没した。
sen.e: In 783, he was promoted to Chunagon but died while staying in Mutsu Province to serve as Mutsu no Azechi (Inspector of Mutsu) and Jisetsu Seito Shogun (the general of conquering east-barbarians).
In 783, he was promoted to Chunagon but died while staying in Mutsu Province to serve as Mutsu no Azechi (Inspector of Mutsu) and Jisetsu Seito Shogun (the general of conquering east-barbarians).
In 783, he was promoted to Chunagon but died while staying in Mutsu Province to serve as Mutsu no Azechi (Inspector of Mutsu) and Jisetsu Seito Shogun (the general of conquering east-barbarians).

sen.j: 没直後に藤原種継暗殺事件が起こり、家持も関与していたとされて、埋葬を許されぬまま除名。
sen.e: The assassination of FUJIWARA no Tanetsugu happened after his death, and Yakamochi was considered to be involved in the assassination, so he was expelled without burial.
The assassination of FUJIWARA no Tanetsugu occurred after Yakamochi's death, and Yakamochi was considered to be involved in the assassination, so he was expelled without burial.
The assassination of FUJIWARA no Tanetsugu occurred after Yakamochi's death, and Yakamochi was considered to be involved in the assassination, so he was expelled without burial.

sen.j: 子の大伴永主も隠岐国に流された。
sen.e: His child OTOMO no Naganushi was exiled to Oki Province.
His child OTOMO no Naganushi was exiled to Oki Province.
His child OTOMO no Naganushi was exiled to Oki Province.

sen.j: 大同 (日本)3年（806年）に従三位に復された。
sen.e: Naganushi was returned as Jusanmi in 806.
Naganushi was restored as Jusanmi in 806.
Naganushi was restored as Jusanmi in 806.

sen.j: 長歌・短歌など合計473首が『万葉集』に収められており、『万葉集』全体の1割を超えている。
sen.e: 473 of his choka (long epic song) and tanka (thirty-one syllables' poem) were collected in "Manyoshu" and those took up over tenth of the total poems in "Manyoshu."
473 of his choka (long epic songs) and tanka (thirty-one-syllable poems) were collected in "Manyoshu," accounting for over tenth of the total poems in "Manyoshu."
473 of his choka (long epic songs) and tanka (thirty-one-syllable poems) were collected in "Manyoshu," accounting for over tenth of the total poems in "Manyoshu."

sen.j: このことから家持が『万葉集』の編纂に拘わったと考えられている。
sen.e: By this reason, Yakamochi was considered to be engaged in compilation of "Manyoshu."
It is for this reason that Yakamochi was considered to be involved in the compilation of "Manyoshu."
It is for this reason that Yakamochi was considered to be involved in the compilation of "Manyoshu."

sen.j: 『万葉集』卷十七～二十は、私家集の観もある。
sen.e: "Manyoshu" Volume 17 to 20 seemed to be Shikashu (a private poetry collection).
"Manyoshu" volumes 17 to 20 appear to be a shikashu (private poetry collection).
"Manyoshu" volumes 17 to 20 appear to be a shikashu (private poetry collection).

sen.j: 『万葉集』の最後は、天平宝字3年（759年）正月の「新しき年の始の初春の 今日降る雪のいや重け吉事（よごと）」（卷二十-4516）である。
sen.e: The last poem of "Manyoshu" was 'Like the snow that falls on this first day of the new year, may there be ever more good things to come' (Volume 20-4516).
The last poem of "Manyoshu" is 'Like the snow that falls on this first day of the new year, may there be ever more good things to come' (Volume 20-4516).
The last poem of "Manyoshu" was made in February 759, 'Like the snow that falls on this first day of the new year, may there be ever more good things to come' (Volume 20-4516).

sen.j: 時に、従五位上因幡守大伴家持は42歳。
sen.e: Once, OTOMO no Yakamochi, Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade), Inaba no kami (Governor of Inaba Province), was 42 years old.
OTOMO no Yakamochi, Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade), Inaba no kami (Governor of Inaba Province) was 42 years old at the time.
OTOMO no Yakamochi, Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade), Inaba no kami (Governor of Inaba Province) was 42 years old at the time.

sen.j: 正五位になるのは、11年後のことである。
sen.e: He became Shogoi (Senior Fifth Rank) 11 years later.
He became Shogoi (Senior Fifth Rank) 11 years later.
He became Shogoi (Senior Fifth Rank) 11 years later.

sen.j: 『百人一首』の歌（かささぎの渡せる橋におく霜の白きを見れば夜ぞ更けにける）は、『万葉集』には入集していない。
sen.e: His poem (On the night of the Star Festival, a magpie bridges over the Milky Way, looking at the stairs in the palace with white frost, I feel evening deepens into the night) in "Hyakunin Isshu" (one hundred waka poems by one hundred poets) was not collected in "Manyoshu."

His poem (On the night of the Star Festival, a magpie bridges over the Milky Way, looking at the stairs in the palace with white frost, I feel evening deepens into the night) in "Hyakunin Isshu" (one hundred waka poems by one hundred poets) was not included in "Manyoshu."

His poem (On the night of the Star Festival, a magpie bridges over the Milky Way, looking at the stairs in the palace with white frost, I feel evening deepens into the night) in "Hyakunin Isshu" (one hundred waka poems by one hundred poets) was not included in "Manyoshu."
